text: hello this is Bill Cunningham there's
not a shadow of a doubt in my mind that
the sensation at this moment in fashion
is on young men's clothes they are
breaking down barriers you can't imagine
what's going on
not since the hippies and the flower
kids tore everything to pod there is
emerging totally new silhouettes
oddly enough the vague outlines seen
both in Paris and in New York based on
the 17th century court dress of men when
they didn't wear knickers
they wore open bottom shorts meaning
they weren't tied to the knee with
leggings
now that's without all the bows and all
of frills and lace of the 17th century
and often times it looks like a skirt
but it may be a kilt in front in shorts
if you look from the back now all of
this really I think my eye in my memory
took place about three years ago here in

then the first ones I saw with it

young men are adapting themselves some
young men let's put it that way but in

tops often in a foam lined fabric so
they stand away from the body and then
the longer shorts with tights
I mean that's amazing and of course many
women are wearing the men's clothes
because frankly very little has happened
in women's fashion outside of comme des
Garcons cutting her one dimensional flat
patent for winter coats to my eye the
peacock the male peacock has escaped his
cage and I don't think anyone's going to
